title: [W]Preference for judge or panel
p1: [W]You can have your case heard by:
hearingPanelBullet2: [W]A judge with two non-legal members, known as a 'panel'.

whatIsAPanel.p1: [W]Non-legal members are lay people appointed because of their particular experience in the workplace as either workers or managers. A panel will consist of a judge, a member with worker or union experience, and a member with management experience. Each has an equal say in the decision.
whatIsAPanel.p2: [W]A judge will decide whether your case is heard by a judge or by a panel. When making this decision, the judge will consider whether the case involves the sort of legal or factual problem where the experience of the non-legal members may help the tribunal reach its decision.

presidentialGuidance.summary: [W]Presidential Guidance explains the types of cases where this experience may help.
presidentialGuidance.link1: [W]Practice Directions and Guidance for Employment Tribunals(England and Wales).

p2: [W]You have an opportunity to say if you would like your case heard by a judge or a panel. The judge will then consider your preference.
p3: [W]If you express a preference, you will be asked to give reasons.

hearingPanelPreference.question: [W]How do you prefer to have your case heard? (Optional)
hearingPanelPreference.judge: [W]I prefer my case to be heard by a judge
hearingPanelPreference.panel: [W]I prefer my case to be heard by a panel including non-legal members
